verses.verse: Therefore <S%G1352><s%> leaving <S%G863><s%> the elementary <S%G746><s%> teaching <S%G3056><s%> about the Christ, <S%G5547><s%> let us press <S%G5342><s%> on to maturity, <S%G5047><s%> not laying <S%G2598><s%> again <S%G3825><s%> a foundation <S%G2310><s%> of repentance <S%G3341><s%> from dead <S%G3498><s%> works <S%G2041><s%> and of faith <S%G4102><s%> toward <S%G1909><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%>

of instruction <S%G1322><s%> about washings, <S%G909><s%> and laying <S%G1936><s%> on of hands, <S%G5495><s%> and the resurrection <S%G386><s%> of the dead, <S%G3498><s%> and eternal <S%G166><s%> judgment. <S%G2917><s%>
And this <S%G3778><s%> we shall do, <S%G4160><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> <S%G4007><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> permits. <S%G2010><s%>

For in the case of those <S%G3588><s%> who have once <S%G530><s%> been enlightened <S%G5461><s%> and have tasted <S%G1089><s%> of the heavenly <S%G2032><s%> gift <S%G1431><s%> and have been <S%G1096><s%> made <S%G1096><s%> partakers <S%G3353><s%> of the Holy <S%G40><s%> Spirit, <S%G4151><s%>
and have tasted <S%G1089><s%> the good <S%G2570><s%> word <S%G4487><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> and the powers <S%G1411><s%> of the age <S%G165><s%> to come, <S%G3195><s%>

and [then] have fallen <S%G3895><s%> away, <S%G3895><s%> it is impossible <S%G102><s%> to renew <S%G340><s%> them again <S%G3825><s%> to repentance, <S%G3341><s%> since they again <S%G388><s%> crucify <S%G388><s%> to themselves <S%G1438><s%> the Son <S%G5207><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> and put <S%G3856><s%> Him to open <S%G3856><s%> shame. <S%G3856><s%>

For ground <S%G1093><s%> that drinks <S%G4095><s%> the rain <S%G5205><s%> which often <S%G4178><s%> falls <S%G2064><s%> upon it and brings <S%G5088><s%> forth <S%G5088><s%> vegetation <S%G1008><s%> useful <S%G2111><s%> to those <S%G1565><s%> for whose <S%G3739><s%> sake <S%G1223><s%> it is also <S%G2532><s%> tilled, <S%G1090><s%> receives <S%G3335><s%> a blessing <S%G2129><s%> from God; <S%G2316><s%>

but if it yields <S%G1627><s%> thorns <S%G173><s%> and thistles, <S%G5146><s%> it is worthless <S%G96><s%> and close <S%G1451><s%> to being cursed, <S%G2671><s%> and it ends <S%G5056><s%> up being burned. <S%G2740><s%>

But, beloved, <S%G27><s%> we are convinced <S%G3982><s%> of better <S%G2909><s%> things <S%G2909><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> you, and things that accompany <S%G2192><s%> salvation, <S%G4991><s%> though <S%G1487><s%> <S%G2532><s%> we are speaking <S%G2980><s%> in this <S%G3779><s%> way. <S%G3779><s%>

For God <S%G2316><s%> is not unjust <S%G94><s%> so as to forget <S%G1950><s%> your work <S%G2041><s%> and the love <S%G26><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> you have shown <S%G1731><s%> toward <S%G1519><s%> His name, <S%G3686><s%> in having ministered <S%G1247><s%> and in still ministering <S%G1247><s%> to the saints. <S%G40><s%>

And we desire <S%G1937><s%> that each <S%G1538><s%> one <S%G1538><s%> of you show <S%G1731><s%> the same <S%G846><s%> diligence <S%G4710><s%> so <S%G4314><s%> as to realize the full <S%G4136><s%> assurance <S%G4136><s%> of hope <S%G1680><s%> until <S%G891><s%> the end, <S%G5056><s%>

that you may not be sluggish, <S%G3576><s%> but imitators <S%G3402><s%> of those <S%G3588><s%> who through <S%G1223><s%> faith <S%G4102><s%> and patience <S%G3115><s%> inherit <S%G2816><s%> the promises. <S%G1860><s%>

For when God <S%G2316><s%> made <S%G1861><s%> the promise <S%G1861><s%> to Abraham, <S%G11><s%> since <S%G1893><s%> He could <S%G2192><s%> swear <S%G3660><s%> by no <S%G3762><s%> one <S%G3762><s%> greater, <S%G3173><s%> He swore <S%G3660><s%> by Himself, <S%G1438><s%>
saying, <S%G3004><s%> "I will surely <S%G3375><s%> <S%G2127><s%> bless <S%G2127><s%> you, and I will surely <S%G4129><s%> multiply <S%G4129><s%> you."
And thus, <S%G3779><s%> having patiently <S%G3114><s%> waited, <S%G3114><s%> he obtained <S%G2013><s%> the promise. <S%G1860><s%>

For men <S%G444><s%> swear <S%G3660><s%> by one <S%G3173><s%> greater <S%G3173><s%> [than themselves], and with them an oath <S%G3727><s%> [given] as confirmation <S%G951><s%> is an end <S%G4009><s%> of every <S%G3956><s%> dispute. <S%G485><s%>

In the same <S%G3739><s%> way God, <S%G2316><s%> desiring <S%G1014><s%> even <S%G4053><s%> more <S%G4053><s%> to show <S%G1925><s%> to the heirs <S%G2818><s%> of the promise <S%G1860><s%> the unchangeableness <S%G276><s%> of His purpose, <S%G1012><s%> interposed <S%G3315><s%> with an oath, <S%G3727><s%>

in order <S%G2443><s%> that by two <S%G1417><s%> unchangeable <S%G276><s%> things, <S%G4229><s%> in which <S%G3739><s%> it is impossible <S%G102><s%> for God <S%G2316><s%> to lie, <S%G5574><s%> we may have <S%G2192><s%> strong <S%G2478><s%> encouragement, <S%G3874><s%> we who have fled <S%G2703><s%> for refuge <S%G2703><s%> in laying <S%G2902><s%> hold <S%G2902><s%> of the hope <S%G1680><s%> set <S%G4295><s%> before <S%G4295><s%> us.

This <S%G3739><s%> hope we have <S%G2192><s%> as an anchor <S%G45><s%> of the soul, <S%G5590><s%> a [hope] both <S%G5037><s%> sure <S%G804><s%> and steadfast <S%G949><s%> and one which enters <S%G1525><s%> within <S%G2082><s%> the veil, <S%G2665><s%>

where <S%G3699><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> has entered <S%G1525><s%> as a forerunner <S%G4274><s%> for us, having become <S%G1096><s%> a high <S%G749><s%> priest <S%G749><s%> forever <S%G165><s%> according <S%G2596><s%> to the order <S%G5010><s%> of Melchizedek. <S%G3198><s%>
